newsitem.title: USA: Florida "Virgin Mary" building may become shrine.
newsitem.headline: Florida "Virgin Mary" building may become shrine.

text.p: A Florida office building that has drawn more than a million people to view a shimmering image they believe is the Virgin Mary will become a permanent shrine if the building's owner has his way.

Police have estimated that some 1.5 million people have flocked to the nondescript building to kneel and pray or merely stare at a large rainbow-colored image on its glass siding that resembles a woman's profile -- to believers, the outline of the Virgin Mary.
Experts said the image were created by mineral deposits from water on the building's side.

But Mike Krizmanich, the owner of the building, said he believes the apparition is a gift from God to be protected and shared. He told Tuesday's Tampa Tribune that he planned to turn the building into a permanent home for the apparition and use its inside office space for a spiritual purpose.
"I don't know how I wound up with it," he told the paper.

Krizmanich's Seminole Finance Corp. was housed in the $1.3 million building until the business was sold this year. But he said he did not want to sell the building, even to a religious organization, and prefers to set up the shrine himself.
